clinical_study.brief_title: Thyroid Replacement Therapy in Patients With Subclinical Hypothyroidism
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Thyroid Replacement Therapy on Thyroid Structure in Patients With Subclinical Hypothyroidism

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this experiment is to compared the changes of thyroid function, anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody, anti-thyroglobulin antibody, thyroid magnetic resonance T1-mapping and various metabolic indexes from baseline to the end of treatment (after the thyroid function had been normal for more than three months)

detailed_description.textblock: In patients with autoimmune thyroiditis with mild subclinical hypothyroidism, the study period will include a screening period of not more than 30 days, and a 12-week treatment period compared to baseline. At completion of treatment, Thyroid Stimulating Hormone(TSH), free thyroxine (FT4)ï¼Œfree thyroxine (FT3) will be included. The changes of anti-thyroglobulin antibody, anti-thyroglobulin antibody, T1-mapping and metabolic indexes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up

primary_outcome.time_frame: free thyroxine changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up
primary_outcome.description: free thyroxine changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up

primary_outcome.time_frame: T1-mapping values of Thyroid MRI Changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up
primary_outcome.description: T1-mapping values of Thyroid MRI Changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up

primary_outcome.time_frame: Free triiodothyronine changes Changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Free triiodothyronine changes Changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: anti-thyroglobulin antibody changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: anti-thyroglobulin antibody changes from baseline and 12 weeks during follow-up

intervention.description: Levothyroxine Sodium(50ug/Tablets,dosage form 25ug,once a day) was administered to patients with autoimmune thyroiditis with mild subclinical hypothyroidism,

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men or women between the ages of 18 and 75;
- Diagnostic criteria for mild subclinical hypothyroidism :TSH>10mIU/L, thyroxine and free thyroxine levels were normal
- Positive thyroglobulin antibody and/or Thyroperoxidase antibody
- No previous use of drugs affecting thyroid function
Exclusion Criteria:
- The contraindications indicated in the Chinese instructions of the drug
- Liver function impairment
- Renal function impairment
- Claustrophobia
- Mental disorders

overall_official.affiliation: Beijing Chao-Yang Hospital, Capital Medical University, Beijing
